opinion.court: Supreme Court of the United States
opinion.case_name: Gerald Glen Boyden v. State of California

opinion:
365 U.S. 650

81 S.Ct. 833

5 L.Ed.2d 857

Gerald Glen BOYDEN
v.
STATE OF CALIFORNIA.

No. 344, Misc.

Supreme Court of the United States

April 3, 1961

Gerald Glen Boyden, pro se.

Stanley Mosk, Atty. Gen. of California, William E. James, Asst. Atty. Gen., and David R. Caldwell, Deputy Atty. Gen., for respondent.

PER CURIAM.

1

The motion to dismiss is granted and the appeal is dismissed. Treating the papers whereon the appeal was taken as a petition for writ of certiorari, certiorari is denied.
